section.title: Generating changes.html
section.p: changes.html can be directly generated from the SVN commit logs with the following procedure:

ul.li: install Saxon 8 (the svn2changes stylesheet requires a XSLT 2.0 processor)
run svn log -v --xml http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/lenya > log.xml in the root of the docu branch. This might take a while as the log file is several MB in size.
run java -jar saxon8.jar -o status.xml log.xml tools/svn2changes.xsl
run forest (You may have to increase forrest.maxmemory in forrest.properties to get around out of memory exceptions.) Forrest will take a LONG TIME to generate changes.html.

section.p: If everything went alright, you will find changes.html, changes.pdf and changes.rss inside your xdocs directory.

section.title: Updating the Lenya website

ul.li: svn co https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/lenya/docu/ lenya.docu ->This is our documentation and website source tree
svn co https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/lenya/site/ lenya.apache.org ->This is our deployed website tree (it is the svn-root for our website)
Install Forrest 0.6 (Note that you need to use 0.6, other version do not work)

li.code: go to the root of lenya/docu

ul.li: forrest (Note that Forrest may claim that the build failed, most of the time this is only because of entries in brokenlinks that can be ignored. If the site looks ok to you, and there were no validation errors, go for it.)
Create and copy the Javadoc for both branches (build javadocs, Copy from build/webapp/site/apidocs to lenya/site/apidocs/1.2 and lenya/site/apidocs/1.4)

section.p: There is a cron job on minotaur which will do 'svn update' every 12 hours (see ~thorsten/bin/mycrontab). If you want to do it manually then ...
